abstract: NFL kickers' extra-point success rate slips several percentage points after league decides to move attempts from 2-yard line to the 15, but expectation of near-perfection remains; immense pressure on kickers is embodied by tragic story of former kicker Steve Little, who was paralyzed after car accident when he reacted to being put on waivers by engaging in night of heavy drinking.
lead_paragraph: With the kicks having been moved from the 2-yard line to the 15 this season, the success rate has taken a hit.

headline.main: With Added Distance, Extra Points Become Less Than Automatic
headline.print_headline: With Added Distance, Extra Points Become Less Than Automatic

snippet: With the kicks having been moved from the 2-yard line to the 15 this season, the success rate has taken a hit.
